resources.string:
Equated Monthly Installments (EMIs) are fixed monthly payments that borrowers make to lenders to pay down their loans. Each EMI is composed of an interest and a principal component, with each amount determined based on the outstanding loan principal, term, and interest rate. 

EMIs are used for many types of loans, such as student loans, auto loans, and home mortgages. The borrower will be able to completely pay off the loan at the end of the loan term if EMIs are made as scheduled. 

Compared to variable payment plans, which allow borrowers to make payments at their discretion based on their periodic incomes, EMIs have a clear repayment schedule and term to maturity.
